00046 #define LOV_USES_ASSIGNED_STRIPE        0
00047 #define LOV_USES_DEFAULT_STRIPE         1
00048 
00049 /* Special values to remove LOV EA from disk */
00050 #define LOVEA_DELETE_VALUES(size, count, offset, pool)                  \
00051         ((size) == 0 && (count) == 0 &&                                 \
00052          (offset) == (typeof(offset))(-1) && (pool) == NULL)
00053 
00054 #define LMVEA_DELETE_VALUES(count, offset)                              \
00055         ((count) == 0 && (offset) == (typeof(offset))(-1))
00056 
00057 #define LOV_OFFSET_DEFAULT              ((__u16)-1)
00058 
00059 struct lod_qos_rr {
00060         spinlock_t               lqr_alloc;     /* protect allocation index */
00061         __u32                    lqr_start_idx; /* start index of new inode */
00062         __u32                    lqr_offset_idx;/* aliasing for start_idx */
00063         int                      lqr_start_count;/* reseed counter */
00064         struct ost_pool          lqr_pool;      /* round-robin optimized list */
00065         unsigned long            lqr_dirty:1;   /* recalc round-robin list */
00066 };
00067 
00068 struct pool_desc {
00069         char                     pool_name[LOV_MAXPOOLNAME + 1];
00070         struct ost_pool          pool_obds;     /* pool members */
00071         atomic_t                 pool_refcount;
00072         struct lod_qos_rr        pool_rr;
00073         struct hlist_node        pool_hash;     /* access by poolname */
00074         struct list_head         pool_list;
00075         struct proc_dir_entry   *pool_proc_entry;
00076         struct obd_device       *pool_lobd;     /* owner */
00077 };
00078 
00079 #define pool_tgt_size(p) ((p)->pool_obds.op_size)
00080 #define pool_tgt_count(p) ((p)->pool_obds.op_count)
00081 #define pool_tgt_array(p)  ((p)->pool_obds.op_array)
00082 #define pool_tgt_rw_sem(p) ((p)->pool_obds.op_rw_sem)
00083 
00084 struct lod_qos {
00085         struct list_head         lq_oss_list;
00086         struct rw_semaphore      lq_rw_sem;
00087         __u32                    lq_active_oss_count;
00088         unsigned int             lq_prio_free;   /* priority for free space */
00089         unsigned int             lq_threshold_rr;/* priority for rr */
00090         struct lod_qos_rr        lq_rr;          /* round robin qos data */
00091         bool                     lq_dirty:1,     /* recalc qos data */
00092                                  lq_same_space:1,/* the ost's all have approx.
00093                                                     the same space avail */
00094                                  lq_reset:1;     /* zero current penalties */
00095 };
00096 
00097 struct lod_qos_oss {
00098         struct obd_uuid          lqo_uuid;      /* ptlrpc's c_remote_uuid */
00099         struct list_head         lqo_oss_list;  /* link to lov_qos */
00100         __u64                    lqo_bavail;    /* total bytes avail on OSS */
00101         __u64                    lqo_penalty;   /* current penalty */
00102         __u64                    lqo_penalty_per_obj; /* penalty decrease
00103                                                          every obj*/
00104         time_t                   lqo_used;      /* last used time, seconds */
00105         __u32                    lqo_ost_count; /* number of osts on this oss */
00106 };
00107 
00108 struct ltd_qos {
00109         struct lod_qos_oss      *ltq_oss;       /* oss info */
00110         __u64                    ltq_penalty;   /* current penalty */
00111         __u64                    ltq_penalty_per_obj; /* penalty decrease
00112                                                          every obj*/
00113         __u64                    ltq_weight;    /* net weighting */
00114         time_t                   ltq_used;      /* last used time, seconds */
00115         bool                     ltq_usable:1;  /* usable for striping */
00116 };
00117 
00118 struct lod_tgt_desc {
00119         struct dt_device  *ltd_tgt;
00120         struct list_head   ltd_kill;
00121         struct obd_export *ltd_exp;
00122         struct obd_uuid    ltd_uuid;
00123         __u32              ltd_gen;
00124         __u32              ltd_index;
00125         struct ltd_qos     ltd_qos; /* qos info per target */
00126         struct obd_statfs  ltd_statfs;
00127         struct ptlrpc_thread    *ltd_recovery_thread;
00128         unsigned long      ltd_active:1,/* is this target up for requests */
00129                            ltd_activate:1,/* should  target be activated */
00130                            ltd_reap:1,  /* should this target be deleted */
00131                            ltd_got_update_log:1, /* Already got update log */
00132                            ltd_connecting:1; /* target is connecting */
00133 };
00134 
00135 #define TGT_PTRS                256     /* number of pointers at 1st level */
00136 #define TGT_PTRS_PER_BLOCK      256     /* number of pointers at 2nd level */
00137 
00138 struct lod_tgt_desc_idx {
00139         struct lod_tgt_desc *ldi_tgt[TGT_PTRS_PER_BLOCK];
00140 };
00141 
00142 #define LTD_TGT(ltd, index)      \
00143          ((ltd)->ltd_tgt_idx[(index) / \
00144          TGT_PTRS_PER_BLOCK]->ldi_tgt[(index) % TGT_PTRS_PER_BLOCK])
00145 
00146 #define OST_TGT(lod, index)   LTD_TGT(&lod->lod_ost_descs, index)
00147 #define MDT_TGT(lod, index)   LTD_TGT(&lod->lod_mdt_descs, index)
00148 struct lod_tgt_descs {
00149         /* list of known TGTs */
00150         struct lod_tgt_desc_idx *ltd_tgt_idx[TGT_PTRS];
00151         /* Size of the lod_tgts array, granted to be a power of 2 */
00152         __u32                   ltd_tgts_size;
00153         /* number of registered TGTs */
00154         __u32                   ltd_tgtnr;
00155         /* bitmap of TGTs available */
00156         struct cfs_bitmap       *ltd_tgt_bitmap;
00157         /* TGTs scheduled to be deleted */
00158         __u32                   ltd_death_row;
00159         /* Table refcount used for delayed deletion */
00160         int                     ltd_refcount;
00161         /* mutex to serialize concurrent updates to the tgt table */
00162         struct mutex            ltd_mutex;
00163         /* read/write semaphore used for array relocation */
00164         struct rw_semaphore     ltd_rw_sem;
00165 };
00166 
00167 struct lod_device {
00168         struct dt_device      lod_dt_dev;
00169         struct obd_export    *lod_child_exp;
00170         struct dt_device     *lod_child;
00171         struct proc_dir_entry *lod_proc_entry;
00172         struct lprocfs_stats *lod_stats;
00173         spinlock_t            lod_connects_lock;
00174         int                   lod_connects;
00175         unsigned int          lod_recovery_completed:1,
00176                               lod_initialized:1,
00177                               lod_lmv_failout:1,
00178                               lod_child_got_update_log:1;
00179 
00180         /* lov settings descriptor storing static information */
00181         struct lov_desc       lod_desc;
00182 
00183         /* use to protect ld_active_tgt_count and all ltd_active */
00184         spinlock_t           lod_desc_lock;
00185 
00186         /* Description of OST */
00187         struct lod_tgt_descs  lod_ost_descs;
00188         /* Description of MDT */
00189         struct lod_tgt_descs  lod_mdt_descs;
00190 
00191         /* Recovery thread for lod_child */
00192         struct ptlrpc_thread    lod_child_recovery_thread;
00193 
00194         /* maximum EA size underlied OSD may have */
00195         unsigned int          lod_osd_max_easize;
00196 
00197         /*FIXME: When QOS and pool is implemented for MDT, probably these
00198          * structure should be moved to lod_tgt_descs as well.
00199          */
00200         /* QoS info per LOD */
00201         struct lod_qos        lod_qos; /* qos info per lod */
00202 
00203         /* OST pool data */
00204         struct ost_pool         lod_pool_info; /* all OSTs in a packed array */
00205         int                     lod_pool_count;
00206         struct cfs_hash        *lod_pools_hash_body; /* used for key access */
00207         struct list_head        lod_pool_list; /* used for sequential access */
00208         struct proc_dir_entry  *lod_pool_proc_entry;
00209 
00210         enum lustre_sec_part   lod_sp_me;
00211 
00212         struct proc_dir_entry *lod_symlink;
00213 };
00214 
00215 #define lod_osts        lod_ost_descs.ltd_tgts
00216 #define lod_ost_bitmap  lod_ost_descs.ltd_tgt_bitmap
00217 #define lod_ostnr       lod_ost_descs.ltd_tgtnr
00218 #define lod_osts_size   lod_ost_descs.ltd_tgts_size
00219 #define ltd_ost         ltd_tgt
00220 #define lod_ost_desc    lod_tgt_desc
00221 
00222 #define lod_mdts                lod_mdt_descs.ltd_tgts
00223 #define lod_mdt_bitmap          lod_mdt_descs.ltd_tgt_bitmap
00224 #define lod_remote_mdt_count    lod_mdt_descs.ltd_tgtnr
00225 #define lod_mdts_size           lod_mdt_descs.ltd_tgts_size
00226 #define ltd_mdt                 ltd_tgt
00227 #define lod_mdt_desc            lod_tgt_desc

00229 struct lod_dir_stripe_info {
00230         __u32   ldsi_stripe_offset;
00231         __u32   ldsi_def_stripenr;
00232         __u32   ldsi_def_stripe_offset;
00233         __u32   ldsi_def_hash_type;
00234         __u32   ldsi_hash_type;
00235 
00236         unsigned int ldsi_def_striping_set:1,
00237                      ldsi_def_striping_cached:1,
00238                      ldsi_striped:1;
00239 };

00241 /*
00242  * XXX: shrink this structure, currently it's 72bytes on 32bit arch,
00243  *      so, slab will be allocating 128bytes
00244  */
00245 struct lod_object {
00246         struct dt_object   ldo_obj;
00247 
00248         /* if object is striped, then the next fields describe stripes */
00249         /* For striped directory, ldo_stripenr == slave stripe count */
00250         __u16              ldo_stripenr;
00251         __u16              ldo_layout_gen;
00252         __u32              ldo_stripe_size;
00253         __u32              ldo_pattern;
00254         __u16              ldo_released_stripenr;
00255         char              *ldo_pool;
00256         struct dt_object **ldo_stripe;
00257         /* to know how much memory to free, ldo_stripenr can be less */
00258         /* default striping for directory represented by this object
00259          * is cached in stripenr/stripe_size */
00260         unsigned int       ldo_stripes_allocated:16,
00261                            ldo_striping_cached:1,
00262                            ldo_def_striping_set:1,
00263                            ldo_def_striping_cached:1,
00264         /* ldo_dir_slave_stripe indicate this is a slave stripe of
00265          * a striped dir */
00266                            ldo_dir_slave_stripe:1;
00267         __u32              ldo_def_stripe_size;
00268         __u16              ldo_def_stripenr;
00269         __u16              ldo_def_stripe_offset;
00270         struct lod_dir_stripe_info      *ldo_dir_stripe;
00271 };
00272 
00273 #define ldo_dir_stripe_offset   ldo_dir_stripe->ldsi_stripe_offset
00274 #define ldo_dir_def_stripenr    ldo_dir_stripe->ldsi_def_stripenr
00275 #define ldo_dir_hash_type       ldo_dir_stripe->ldsi_hash_type
00276 #define ldo_dir_def_hash_type   ldo_dir_stripe->ldsi_def_hash_type
00277 #define ldo_dir_striped         ldo_dir_stripe->ldsi_striped
00278 #define ldo_dir_def_striping_set        ldo_dir_stripe->ldsi_def_striping_set
00279 #define ldo_dir_def_striping_cached     ldo_dir_stripe->ldsi_def_striping_cached
00280 #define ldo_dir_def_stripe_offset       ldo_dir_stripe->ldsi_def_stripe_offset
00281 
00282 struct lod_it {
00283         struct dt_object        *lit_obj; /* object from the layer below */
00284         /* stripe offset of iteration */
00285         __u32                   lit_stripe_index;
00286         __u32                   lit_attr;
00287         struct dt_it            *lit_it;  /* iterator from the layer below */
00288 };

00290 struct lod_thread_info {
00291         /* per-thread buffer for LOV EA, may be vmalloc'd */
00292         void             *lti_ea_store;
00293         __u32             lti_ea_store_size;
00294         /* per-thread buffer for LMV EA */
00295         struct lu_buf     lti_buf;
00296         struct ost_id     lti_ostid;
00297         struct lu_fid     lti_fid;
00298         struct obd_statfs lti_osfs;
00299         struct lu_attr    lti_attr;
00300         struct lod_it     lti_it;
00301         struct ldlm_res_id lti_res_id;
00302         /* used to hold lu_dirent, sizeof(struct lu_dirent) + NAME_MAX */
00303         char              lti_key[sizeof(struct lu_dirent) + NAME_MAX];
00304         struct dt_object_format lti_format;
00305         struct lu_name    lti_name;
00306         struct lu_buf     lti_linkea_buf;
00307         struct dt_insert_rec lti_dt_rec;
00308         struct llog_catid lti_cid;
00309         struct llog_cookie lti_cookie;
00310         struct lustre_cfg lti_lustre_cfg;
00311 };

00313 extern const struct lu_device_operations lod_lu_ops;
00314 
00315 static inline int lu_device_is_lod(struct lu_device *d)
00316 {
00317         return ergo(d != NULL && d->ld_ops != NULL, d->ld_ops == &lod_lu_ops);
00318 }
00319 
00320 static inline struct lod_device* lu2lod_dev(struct lu_device *d)
00321 {
00322         LASSERT(lu_device_is_lod(d));
00323         return container_of0(d, struct lod_device, lod_dt_dev.dd_lu_dev);
00324 }
00325 
00326 static inline struct lu_device *lod2lu_dev(struct lod_device *d)
00327 {
00328         return &d->lod_dt_dev.dd_lu_dev;
00329 }
00330 
00331 static inline struct obd_device *lod2obd(struct lod_device *d)
00332 {
00333         return d->lod_dt_dev.dd_lu_dev.ld_obd;
00334 }
00335 
00336 static inline struct lod_device *dt2lod_dev(struct dt_device *d)
00337 {
00338         LASSERT(lu_device_is_lod(&d->dd_lu_dev));
00339         return container_of0(d, struct lod_device, lod_dt_dev);
00340 }
00341 
00342 static inline struct lod_object *lu2lod_obj(struct lu_object *o)
00343 {
00344         LASSERT(ergo(o != NULL, lu_device_is_lod(o->lo_dev)));
00345         return container_of0(o, struct lod_object, ldo_obj.do_lu);
00346 }
00347 
00348 static inline struct lu_object *lod2lu_obj(struct lod_object *obj)
00349 {
00350         return &obj->ldo_obj.do_lu;
00351 }
00352 
00353 static inline struct lod_object *lod_obj(const struct lu_object *o)
00354 {
00355         LASSERT(lu_device_is_lod(o->lo_dev));
00356         return container_of0(o, struct lod_object, ldo_obj.do_lu);
00357 }
00358 
00359 static inline struct lod_object *lod_dt_obj(const struct dt_object *d)
00360 {
00361         return lod_obj(&d->do_lu);
00362 }
00363 
00364 static inline struct dt_object* lod_object_child(struct lod_object *o)
00365 {
00366         return container_of0(lu_object_next(lod2lu_obj(o)),
00367                         struct dt_object, do_lu);
00368 }

00370 extern struct lu_context_key lod_thread_key;
00371 
00372 static inline struct lod_thread_info *lod_env_info(const struct lu_env *env)
00373 {
00374         struct lod_thread_info *info;
00375         info = lu_context_key_get(&env->le_ctx, &lod_thread_key);
00376         LASSERT(info);
00377         return info;
00378 }
00379 
00380 static inline struct lu_name *
00381 lod_name_get(const struct lu_env *env, const void *area, int len)
00382 {
00383         struct lu_name *lname;
00384 
00385         lname = &lod_env_info(env)->lti_name;
00386         lname->ln_name = area;
00387         lname->ln_namelen = len;
00388         return lname;
00389 }
00390 
00391 #define lod_foreach_ost(__dev, index)   \
00392         if ((__dev)->lod_osts_size > 0) \
00393                 cfs_foreach_bit((__dev)->lod_ost_bitmap, (index))
00394 
00395 #define lod_foreach_mdt(mdt_dev, index) \
00396         cfs_foreach_bit((mdt_dev)->lod_mdt_bitmap, (index))
